title: Project-Based Language Learning for Resilience and Professional Ethics Enhancement for Polytechnic Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language communication skills (reading, writing, listening, speaking) and foundational understanding of professional work environments
context.additional_context: Provides a customized language learning environment through an interdisciplinary approach and the ATI (Aptitude-Treatment Interaction) model. Supports continuous and contextual language learning via digital devices (text analysis, online discussions, multimedia resources).

learning_goals: Learners will enhance their ability to solve problems by applying resilience strategies in professional scenarios through linguistic expressions (speaking/writing).
Learners will textually analyze professional ethics codes and apply ethical decision-making frameworks to real project situations through linguistic communication (discussions/reports).

Using an interdisciplinary approach (engineering + humanities + business), learners will linguistically collaborate (meetings/document drafting) with team members in complex work scenarios (e.g., global project management), proposing at least three creative solutions, and achieving an average of 4/5 or higher in peer and instructor evaluations.

In monthly formative assessments, learners will score 7/10+ on resilience scales, meet six or more of eight ethical awareness checklist items through linguistic expressions (essays/presentations), and submit an improvement plan in linguistic format (report) within two weeks based on results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
